title: Skills & Strengths Discovery
description: Help us understand your natural talents and what you're good at

questions.question: Think about a time when you felt most capable or confident. What were you doing, and why did it feel natural to you?
questions.placeholder: Describe the situation, what you were doing, and what made you feel successful...

questions.question: When you're learning something new, what usually helps you learn fastest?

options.label: Jumping in and trying it myself

questions.question: What activities or tasks do people often compliment you on or ask for your help with?
questions.placeholder: e.g., 'My friends always ask me to help them plan events' or 'People say I explain things clearly' or 'I'm usually the one who notices mistakes'...

questions.question: When facing a problem or challenge, what's your first instinct?

options.label: Analyze the situation logically to understand the root cause
Brainstorm creative solutions and new approaches
Research what others have done in similar situations
Bring people together to solve it as a team
Take immediate action and adjust as I go

questions.question: How would you rate your attention to small details vs. big picture thinking?
questions.minLabel: I focus on details - I notice small things others miss
questions.maxLabel: I focus on big picture - I see overall patterns and themes

questions.question: Which of these activities give you energy? (Select all that apply)

options.label: Creating something new (designs, content, ideas, projects)
Analyzing information, data, or complex situations
Helping others solve problems or achieve their goals
Leading groups or taking charge of initiatives
Learning new concepts, skills, or subjects
Communicating ideas to others through speaking or writing
Building relationships and connecting with people

questions.question: Describe a project, activity, or accomplishment you're proud of (from school, work, volunteering, hobbies, etc.)
questions.placeholder: What did you do? What was challenging about it? What did you learn about yourself?

questions.question: Which best describes how you prefer to communicate your ideas?

options.label: A combination - depends on the situation

questions.question: What topics or subjects naturally interest you? (Select up to 4)

options.label: Business, economics, and how organizations work
Social issues, justice, and making a difference
Global affairs, culture, and international topics

questions.question: How comfortable are you with uncertainty and situations where there's no clear answer?
questions.minLabel: I prefer clear guidelines and structured approaches
questions.maxLabel: I'm comfortable with ambiguity and figuring things out

questions.question: What do you wish you were better at? What skills or abilities would you like to develop?
questions.placeholder: Be honest about areas where you'd like to grow...

questions.question: How do you feel about working with numbers, data, and quantitative information?

options.label: Very comfortable - numbers make sense to me
I can work with them when needed
I find it challenging but manageable
I prefer to avoid heavy quantitative work

questions.question: Which languages can you use professionally? (Select all that apply)
When you hit a difficult challenge, how persistent are you?
questions.minLabel: I tend to move on if something is too difficult
questions.maxLabel: I keep trying until I figure it out
